skill.name: analyzing-response-quality
skill.description: Expert at analyzing the quality of Claude's responses and outputs. Use when evaluating response completeness, accuracy, clarity, or effectiveness. Auto-invokes during self-reflection or when quality assessment is needed.
skill.summary: Expert at analyzing the quality of Claude's responses and outputs. Use when evaluating response comp...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Skill contains 3 Python validation scripts for code quality, completeness, and security checking. All scripts are self-contained, process input locally, and align with the skill's quality analysis purpose. No network access, no external commands, no credential access.

content.value_statement: Claude responses may have gaps, errors, or unclear explanations. This skill provides a structured 6-dimension framework to evaluate and improve response quality including correctness, completeness, clarity, efficiency, security, and usability.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates response correctness, accuracy, and functionality
Checks completeness against requirements and edge cases
Analyzes clarity, structure, and communication effectiveness
Detects security vulnerabilities in code (SQLi, XSS, injection)
Identifies code quality issues (style, error handling, documentation)
Scores responses across 6 quality dimensions with recommendations
limitations: Automated scripts are not yet implemented - manual framework only
Cannot access external tools or APIs for verification
Quality scores are subjective guidelines, not objective metrics
Does not execute code to verify functionality

use_cases.title: Self-review before responses
use_cases.description: Claude automatically reviews its own code and explanations before finalizing complex technical responses.

use_cases.title: Quality scoring for PRs
use_cases.description: Generate systematic quality reports for code submissions with scores and improvement recommendations.

use_cases.title: Validate explanation completeness
use_cases.description: Check that technical explanations cover all requirements with clear examples and edge case handling.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my last response for quality issues. Check correctness, completeness, and clarity. List any gaps found.

prompt_templates.title: Code Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the code I just provided. Check for bugs, security issues, missing error handling, and code quality problems.

prompt_templates.title: Requirement Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my response against the original requirements. Which requirements were not fully addressed? What edge cases were missed?

prompt_templates.title: Full Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a full quality analysis report using the 6-dimension framework. Include scores, critical issues, and specific recommendations for improvement.

output_examples.input: Review this response for quality: I implemented user authentication with a login function that queries the database using string concatenation.
output: Quality Scores: Correctness 3/5, Completeness 2/5, Clarity 4/5, Efficiency 3/5, Security 1/5, Usability 3/5
Critical Issue: SQL injection vulnerability - login function uses string concatenation for database queries
Missing: Password hashing, rate limiting, session management, error handling for failed logins
Recommendations: Use parameterized queries immediately, add bcrypt for password hashing, implement rate limiting

best_practices: Use the full 6-dimension framework for comprehensive reviews rather than focusing on only one area
Provide specific evidence (line numbers, code snippets) when identifying issues for actionable feedback
Balance criticism with acknowledgment of strengths to maintain constructive improvement culture
anti_patterns: Vague feedback without specific locations or evidence does not help improvement
Ignoring usability or clarity issues and only focusing on code correctness
Providing scores without explanations of why those scores were assigned

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It may work with other Anthropic products that support skills.

faq.question: What quality dimensions are evaluated?
faq.answer: Six dimensions: Correctness, Completeness, Clarity, Efficiency, Security, and Usability. Each scored 1-5.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code?
faq.answer: No. The skill analyzes text and code patterns. It does not run or test code. Automated validation scripts are planned.

faq.question: How is data handled?
faq.answer: All analysis is performed locally. No data is sent to external services. Input is processed only in memory.

faq.question: Why are scores subjective?
faq.answer: Quality assessment requires judgment about context, requirements, and audience. The framework guides analysis but scores reflect reasoned assessment.

faq.question: How does this compare to linters?
faq.answer: This skill evaluates higher-level quality (completeness, clarity) beyond what linters check. Linters find syntax issues; this skill finds gaps and effectiveness problems.
